author: STAFF WRITERS
title: Ashley Stevens shut down Reddit trolls who fat-shamed her boyfriend |
text:
A 21-YEAR-OLD woman has come out swinging in defence of her boyfriend after he was cruelly fat-shamed online.
In late June, a photo of Ashley Stevens and her partner of three years, Christopher Glenn Reed, at a wedding turned up on Reddit .
The photo was shared on the social networking/news site by a friend of Stevens’, with the caption, “My friend caught the bouquet. That is her boyfriend in the background”.
It didn’t take long for users to start mocking Reed’s physical appearance, calling him “fat” and “ugly” and posting comments such as, “He’s clearly punching above his weight,” and, “See, this is what people mean when they say ‘it’s what on the inside that counts’.”
But in a classy response posted on Twitter , Stevens put the haters back in their place, saying, “I won the jackpot with Christopher”.
“He may not have rock hard abs like the world tells girls to want in a guy, but really, why does that even matter when you are trying to really find someone you want to spend the rest of your life with?” she wrote.
“I love him for who he is and he loves me for who I am.”
Stevens’ smackdown has since gone viral and she later told People magazine that she feels like “the luckiest girl in the world”.
“People should care about what’s inside. What matters is how happy and special he makes me feel.”
Well played Ashley and Chris.
Haters gonna hate. @chrisglennreed Source: Facebook
Originally published as Woman’s epic Facebook response to fat-shamers
